newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech crown stable with focus on government.
newsitem.headline: Czech crown stable with focus on government.

text.p: The Czech crown was stable in early trade on Wednesday and dealers said the market was focused on talks aimed at finalising a government reshuffle.
The crown stood at 19.411 against the mark at 0910 GMT, little changed from opening levels.

"The Czech crown is waiting for what will happen on the political side of things," said trader Milan Vavra of Komercni Banka. "Political destabilisation is the most important thing for foreign investors so nobody is doing a lot of business in foreign exchange," he said.

Czech Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus earlier cancelled a trip to the Netherlands in order to continue talks with partners in his three-party centre-right coalition on restructuring the cabinet. The government also cancelled its regular Wednesday meeting.
The coalition leaders agreed last week to make changes in the cabinet after a sharp drop in its popularity spurred by an economic downturn and widespread reports of financial crime.
"If a new government will not be established in the near future, I expect that the Czech crown will go lower again," said Vavra.
The central bank, from Tuesday, scrapped the bands within which the crown fluctuated against a mark/dollar basket, allowing the currency to float.
As expected, it depreciated significantly. It stands at about 10.8 percent weaker than the old central parity of the basket, compared with about -2.8 percent before the bands were scrapped.
